document.ModsDocTitle: Ten new species of the spider genus Althepus Thorell, 1898 from Southeast Asia (Araneae, Ochyroceratidae)
document.docAuthor: Li, Fengyuan, Liu, Chang & Li, Shuqiang
document.docTitle: Althepus phousalao Li & Li, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Ten new species of the spider genus Althepus Thorell, 1898 from Southeast Asia (Araneae, Ochyroceratidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Ten new species of the spider genus Althepus Thorell, 1898 from Southeast Asia (Araneae, Ochyroceratidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Althepus phousalao Li & Li
sp. n. Figs 9, 10, 20, 21
Holotype: ♂, Laos, Champasak Province, Pakse City, Phou Salao, 15°05.284'N , 105°48.671'E , 242 m a.s.l., 15.XI.2012, Z. Yao. Paratype: 1♀, same data as holotype.
The specific epithet is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality Phou Salao, Laos.

Althepus phousalao Li & Li, sp. n. resembles A. leucosternum Deeleman-Reinhold, 1995, in having a triangular distal end of the conductor and one retrolateral spine of cymbium in males, and one spermatheca on each side in females. Males can be distinguished by the longer conductor (versus shorter in A. leucosternum ) (Figure 9B). Females can be distinguished by one thicker, longer spermatheca on each side (versus shorter in A. leucosternum ) (Figure 10A), can be distinguished from all the other known species of the genus by the thick spermathecae (Figure 10A).

caption.paragraph: Figure 9. Althepus phousalao Li & Li, sp. n., male holotype. A Palp, ventral view B Palpal bulb, ventral view C Palp, retrolateral view D Palp, prolateral view. Abbreviations: CO conductor; EM embolus; CP cymbial protrusion; HS hook-shaped spine; SB serrated bristles.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female (paratype). Total length 3.20; carapace 0.94 length, 1.13 width; abdomen 1.72 length, 1.00 width. Similar to male in colour and general features of carapace (Figure 10D, E) but smaller. Abdomen elongate, with complex patterns dorsally and ventrally. Internal genitalia with one curved, elongate spermatheca on each side (Figure 10A). Leg measurements: I 26.18 (6.54, 0.48, 7.05, 10.51, 1.60), II missing, III 11.06 (3.25, 0.45, 2.75, 3.55, 1.06), IV 15.84 (4.55, 0.47, 4.36, 5.13, 1.33).

caption.paragraph: Figure 10. Althepus phousalao Li & Li, sp. n., male holotype and female paratype. A Internal genitalia, dorsal view B Female epigastric furrow, ventral view C Male habitus, dorsal view D Female habitus, dorsal view E Female habitus, ventral view. Abbreviation: SP spermatheca.

subSubSection.paragraph: Laos. Known only from the type locality (Figure 21).
Collected in a pit of Phou Salao at an altitude of 242 m.
Althepus phousalao Li & Li, sp. n., was labelled as "sp. 23" in Li and Li (2018) .
